meanings.definition: To be in an upright position on the feet.
meanings.sent1: I stand up when I want to reach something high.
meanings.sent2: She likes to stand by the window and watch the birds.
meanings.sent3: The toy soldier couldn't stand still, always falling over.
meanings.sent4: His determination to stand tall in the face of adversity inspired others.
meanings.sent5: The image of the lone tree standing against the storm was powerful.

meanings.definition: To take a position or remain firm in support of something.
meanings.sent1: I stand with my friend when they need me.
meanings.sent2: The community decided to stand together against injustice.
meanings.sent3: The book characters stand up for what they believe in.
meanings.sent4: Her principles make her stand out among her peers.
meanings.sent5: The foundation of their friendship is their ability to stand by each other.

meanings.definition: A structure on which something can be placed.
meanings.sent1: The cake was displayed on a beautiful stand.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new plant stand for her garden.
meanings.sent3: The stand at the fair collapsed under the weight of the prizes.
meanings.sent4: The stand held up the heavy books without any issue.
meanings.sent5: The stand was carefully crafted from sturdy wood.

meanings.definition: A group of trees or plants growing closely together.
meanings.sent1: The forest was filled with a stand of tall trees.
meanings.sent2: The botanical garden had a stand of colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The stand of bamboo swayed gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The stand of pines provided a cool shade on hot days.
meanings.sent5: The stand of sunflowers brightened up the field.
